intro: Stenolobium tanaeciiflorum, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces leguminous pods that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in warm climates. Its rapid growth and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to gardens and landscapes.
